No one can Ever..
Wt a masterpiece sir . . salute 2 u for ur hard work . You are a gem 💎 sir . Really really beautiful movie. I wish all INDIANS 🇮🇳 must watch this movie. From my side OSCAR for you sir .

#RocketryTheNambiEffectSlow Steady Educational/Motivational/Moral/Truth Saying Film. Life History of ISRO Scientist Mr. Nambi Narayanan. Very emotionally connected Pure Drama with Good Story Mode and Engaging Screenplay. Greatly Written, Directed, Acted by R. Madhavan. SFX, VFX, Artwork, Editing - Perfect. Sam CS music and Sirsha Ray Cinematography gave grips to the Film along with story. All departments and all characters have given their best. Used more Technical Terms and concepts related to Aerospace by undergoing big research. It need to be appreciated. Nice Locations with Great Visuals. Standing Applause to the Whole Rocketry Team for giving such a great film.We all praised the success of ISRO's Mars Mission. But we didn't know/hear the hard times were there behind it. This story revealed some of those and tough times in Nambi Narayanan Life.The Nambi Effect (Bio Pic) - An Experience#Rocketry #RocketryTheFilm.

The movie is basically a biographical on ISRO scientist Nambi Narayan and his struggle to introduce the cryogenic engine in Indian Space science.. he was falsely accused of espionage and the movie is about the brilliance behind Nambi's efforts.. Definitely take your kids to theatre to watch this movie...

This film is based on Scientist Nambi Narayanan and his contributions to liquid fuel engines in India followed by the incidents where he was wrongly held guilty for betraying his nation. This film is presented in an interview way where our beloved SRK interviews Mr. Nambi.I must say the biopic has been made in a very interesting way. It keeps you hooked till the very end. Occasionally there are light humorous moments and go very well with the flow. It is also quite informative about the journey of liquid fuel engines in our country. Towards the end, the film does get really emotional and you feel bad for Mr. Nambi when SRK pleads him for apology for what he went through.R. Madhavan absolutely nails this role. It seems he put in a lot of effort in making this film. Not only does he ace the humorous scenes but also kills it in the emotional scenes with his wife towards the end. He has lived this role. I think all the brownie points of this film is scored by Madhavan thanks to his direction as well, he has managed to make a film that is very engaging and enjoyable and emotional at the same time.Nambi's friends too give a very good performance especially that one friend who started stammering when he tried speaking to a beautiful lady was hilarious 😂. Nambi's wife too does a very good job.SRK has an extended cameo as the interviewer and must say, for such a small not so significant role like this, only a man with a big heart and yet being a big superstar can accept this role and that is SRK. Only big actor other than SRK was Amir Khan who is known to play such small cameos in films otherwise normally you see superstars denying such small role. SRK's last act where he begs for apology on behalf of whole nation stole the show.Negatives - i still can't believe how poorly foreign people are showcases in films . Till date they are portrayed as stereotypical and caricaturish characters . High time they be portrayed as more matured..Overall, a film that you must invest your money in and i guarantee you it will be worth your time and money.

This is a kind of movie everyone wants to watch...not like fake nationalism shown by Akshay kumar in prithvi raj movie...Nambi narayan was a true patriot and this fact id very well depicted in this movie...excellent movie.

R Madhavan aka Rocketry Madhavan , what a great movie to Debut with, as a Director . The movie is on Mr. Nambi Narayanan , an ISRO scientist who underwent so much of physical and mental trauma after getting framed of being a spy and arrested by Indian govt only to be later released confirming he's guilt free . Nambi is one successful scientist who had worked along with Dr Kalam sir in 1990s . It was a pleasure to know about this actual SuperStar born on 12th Dec who aimed for stars from our mother land . A movie made on him is now nothing less than an Absolute Sensation, this might not be even the apt word to mention the class of the movie , it's beyond words , may be beyond the blue sky , the stars , the galaxies possible beyond several planets . Gone are those days when I used to think Biopic's are the easiest to make , but this movie proved it wrong . So much hardwork put in by the entire crew. But for once we should agree it's definitely a Rocket Science, for few of the conversations with reference to it was a bit of challenge to understand :) still it's very minimal and ignorable . R Madhavan, one of the finest actor we have in the world cinema features as Nambi and does an extremely brilliant performance and adding to it beyond acting through this movie he also proves himself as a man with great visionary working from the seats of a director. Paired with him is Simran, she's one impeccable actress who can steal everyone's heart anyday by appearing onscreen even if it happened for a millisecond . Beyond these two there are definitely more stars to mention for their remarkable performances. Surya adds some attraction in a cameo role. The screenplay was almost flawless, the BGM, the CGI and the re-recording needs a special mention here. Dialogues in Tamil was top notch , extremely enjoyable . However the director could have avoided making the foreign nationals speak in Tamil which sounded more like the language spoken Shim Chan cartoons :). Again ignore and start your countdown to fly towards the movie hall to witness this Indian wonder. Overall Rocketry, a Mission to Oscars ! .

Rocketry-the nambi effect is an action biography drama sci-fi film directed by madhavan.Madhavan, the actor has given a stellar performance in this film. Basically, the film revolves around him and his character only is purely fleshed out and he has justified it. Simran, as meena too gives an empathetic performance. The rest of the cast is good. The foreign actors seem to be good but i am not sure about it because someone took a conscious decision to dub their french and english and russian all into hindi and that takes out the gravity from the dialogues. I can say for me, that many a times i was disconnected becausd of the dubbing. There was no need to dub the foreign languages into hindi.The writing too is pretty good. The scientific terms about rocket science, the concepts are not oversimplified for the audience which i liked being a science student myself. I like mission mangal too but taking out the scientific approach from a science film does not justify it. Other characters apart from nambi are not really written well. Even we don't get to know much about his family members and that is the exact reason why we can connect with nambi but not with his family members so much. The screenplay is pretty much engaging specially the second half where the drama portion is built well. The first half feels a bit stretched because of the reason of dubbing etc. But it does not harm the film.The vfx used is pretty solid. It does not come across as amateurish so points for that as well. The set design and production design is also really good. The 1900s europe and USA was built really well. The hairstyles, the moustaches, the costumes make it look authentic. The cinematography is okayish nothing extraordinary.It feels really good to see SRK on the screen after so long though in an extended cameo. He too has given a solid performance.This is a solid film boasting of an earnest attempt by madhavan in showing the life of a person who was wronged by his nation. After all "a country is called great only when the country respects those who make it great". This is a film you should definitely watch. I rate it 7.8 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: Recommended 👍🏼 by Hit Ya Flop - Movie World
reviews.content: An important film with an exceptional story that must be told. R Madhavan has turned director with this film and in his debut directorial he impressed everybody and handled the film very well. Hats off to Madhavan for picking this subject and not making it an overdramatized film. He deserves an applaud to show how Vikram Sarabhai, APJ Abdul Kalam, Neil Armstrong, and Cleaver Hughes were impressed by Nambi's achievements.The pace of the film in the first half is slow and a lot of rocket science jargon is used due to which it becomes difficult for some viewers to connect with the scenes. The second half is better and more engaging. It offers a few stirring & emotional moments of Nambi's interrogation, society's reaction on his family, and the climax showing Nambi Narayanan himself was the stand-out scene.This is an Award-winning performance by Madhavan, he surprises the audience with his look & body language and how he transforms into Nambi Narayanan. The makeup department does an impressive job. Simran was outstanding in the second half of the film. Shah Rukh Khan is excellent in a special appearance and his presence upraised the film. The supporting cast has done their job well with the limited written roles.Other highlights of the film are the cinematography and the background music which enhances the impact in several scenes. There was a large room for the crisp editing in the first of the film, with a runtime of 157 minutes, the film seems too lengthy.
Each and every person worked in this movie deserves appreciation they really did a great Job.Maddy superb acting and happy to see King back in screen after long time. SRK FIRE.

reviews.review_title: A good biopic of an Indian gem
reviews.content: Rocketry - 7.3/10A good comeback in the 2nd half and somehow saved the almost flat movie in the first half with too many deliberate unnecessary ostentatious totally randomly put scenes. Some of 'em didn't even have the relevance in the movie like the Rolls Royce thing, hydraulic engines for practice and no display of that in the movie simply puts forward the intentional KOHINOOR topic. Yes some chilling moments when VIKAS went beyond 135 secs but the superhero thing was completely uncalled for. The fundamental gap between the audience and the pace of the movie in the first half is like you run on a treadmill but the treadmill's and your speeds are different, so you will definitely meet the accident. The first half was just to show how great the rocket scientist was but with no continuity whatsoever. The 2nd half was the savior when the same scientist was jailed for being a traitor. The story calms down so does the screenplay and audience starts connecting and relating the marvelous yet irrelevant 1st half. Good acting, dialogue delivery in the 2nd half. Overall, a good watch but yes, the 9.1 is definitely too much. India needs to slow down in emotions and react to the right content instead of selling itself with biases.

reviews.review_title: R Madhavan Starrer 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' is a Perfection to Direction !!!
reviews.content: Rocketry: The Nambi Effect explores Narayanan's life as an arrogant but brilliant scientist who becomes the first person from ISRO to attend an Ivy League University (Princeton). He also manages to secure an unbelievable deal (worth 400 million pounds) from Colonel Cleaver (Ron Donachie), the CEO of Rolls Royce- armed with charm and aided by Cleaver's apparent "Imperial Guilt".Rocketry begins with an extended shot that suitably begins in space and travels down all the way to Earth, where we are introduced to Nambi's family. With just a few lines of conversation, Madhavan, who is also making his debut as a filmmaker, gives us a peek into the joyful family of his protagonist. When we meet them first, the family is joking around, unaware of the peril that is on their doorstep. And boom, their world turns upside down as Nambi is arrested on charges of spying.The film plays out in flashback as Nambi Narayanan (R Madhavan) narrates his life story to superstar Shah Rukh Khan in 2014. The crew filming this mammoth interview is cursing their luck for being stuck in the studio late at night for a 'long and boring' story of an old scientist. However, as Nambi begins talking, everyone including the host are riveted to his story.Madhavan dutifully covers every aspect of Nambi's journey, especially his professional feats and challenges. Nambi's mentor is none other than the prolific Vikram Sarabhai (Rajit Kapoor), who knows his prodigy only too well. When Nambi gets a full scholarship from Princeton University, he takes it up despite the obvious mismatch in what he is offered and what he wants to study. But not the one to toe the line, Nambi finds a way to not only learn what he wants but also be the best at it. So much so that he is offered a job by NASA but he chooses to work for ISRO instead and do whatever it takes to propel India's space mission.While Nambi's work life is exciting and fraught with challenges, it is also way too technical and Madhavan doesn't shy away from throwing complex astronomy terms and jargons at the audience. The entire first half is spent in showing various facets of Nambi's slightly eccentric personality and astral experiments where the very animated background score acts as a pointer for us to root for our protagonist. At times, the context is lost in technicalities and we're forced to focus on the big picture. The non-linear execution is exciting and generates anticipation but also adds to the confusion.R Madhavan relives Nambi Narayanan's real life in reel with full conviction. From his make-up to dialogue delivery and expression, Madhavan becomes the man whose story he tells. Shah Rukh Khan looks dapper as ever and uses his trademark charm to play the role of an interviewer with a heart. He mirrors the conscience of a nation for a man, who dedicated his life to a cause against all odds. Simran is a surprise package as the sensitive and dignified Meena Narayanan. Simran's portrayal goes a long way in humanising Nambi's passion for his work and the hardships he endures. Among the supporting actors, Sam Mohan stands out as Unni, whose character is a lot more fleshed out than others.The second half is much stronger and emotionally draining but the film's pace remains slow. It's no rocket science that this one's a niche film. It has an interesting subject and an untold story of a man, who was wronged for always being right for his nation. 'Rocketry' takes off well, hits some turbulence on the way, but eventually soars high with real characters and moving moments that make it worth your while.
Shahrukh Khan is extraordinary 🔥🔥🔥 R Madhava nailed it with camera and acting. Story line Is perfect. It is watchable can't ignore srk. One word review fire.

reviews.review_title: R. Madhavan Ensures A Safe Take-Off While Unfolding The Dramatic Life Of Nambi Nayanan Filled With Unbearable Strife.
reviews.content:
Rocketry (2022) :
Movie Review -One of the finest actors in the country, R. Madhavan, has finally shown the courage to bring the controversial life of Nambi Narayanan to the silver screen with Rockery: The Nambi Effect. This is quite like a biopic era for our generation, and frankly, it is getting too much nowadays. However, there are some biopics that are worthwhile. There are some stories that deserve to be told in cinematic aspects so that more and more people will know about them. R. Madhavan's film, Rocketry, is definitely one of those few films. The sensational story of the great Nambi Narayanan deserves your attention for sure.Rocketry is based on the life of Nambi Narayanan, a former scientist and aerospace engineer of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), who was falsely accused of espionage. The film shows us the great sacrifices he has made for the country, the great achievements that have helped the Indian Space Organisation to stand equally with global superpowers, the great torture he endured, and his great patriotism. Overall, it's all about his Greatness! At the same time, the film does not hesitate to show the ugly face of our system, which includes cops, politicians, and many faceless and unknown threats. R. Madhavan's writing tries to cover most of the events, and fortunately it succeeds in collecting most of them within 150 minutes. There are some fantastic scenes which will leave you with joy, tears and jitters, but there are a few scenes that will make you feel guilty for doing nothing. We have all been just mute spectators while Mr. Nambi Narayana was going through hell on earth. While we talk about pluses, we should not forget the flaws. Rockery has a few dull moments, a couple of overdramatic scenes, and some unnecessary masala which could have been avoided. The first half is a little complicated for the masses. I am sure those backbenchers would feel like going back to physics classes during those scenes, and unfortunately, there are no Hindi subtitles, either. The second half is much better, though, and it manages to cover the lost ground somehow.Rocketry is all about R. Madhavan's brilliance. The actor R. Madhavan. I was counting his finest performances, such as "Alaipayuthey" (2000), "Anbe Sivam" (2003), "3 Idiots" (2009) and "Vikram Vedha" (2017). Rocketry: The Nambi Effect is one more addition to this great list. Yes, he is that good here. There were a few scenes where I think he went wrong with the accent, but the rest of the time, he was truly flawless. Simran, backed by years of experience, excels in the role of Meena Narayanan. She may not have too many scenes, but whatever scenes she has, she is phenomenal in those. The small but important roles of Gulshan Grover as APJ Abdul Kalam and Rajit Kapur as Vikram Sarabhai are delightful. In the supporting roles, Misha Ghoshal, Muralidharan, Dinesh Prabhakar, Karthik Kumar, Phyllis Logan, Vincent Riotta, Shyam Renganathan, Sam Mohan, Sriram Parthasarathy, Rajeev Ravindranathan and Bijou Thaangjam are superb. Shah Rukh Khan has about 10-12 minutes of screentime, and he seduces you with his charm. He's not in that form in the beginning, but picks up later on. Watch out for the final scenes that have him in those highly emotional segments.Rocketry seems like a big-budget film when you see it on screen. Shot across multiple countries, this one is a lavish outing despite its moderate budget. Sirsha Ray's cinematography makes sure that you feel the locations, and more importantly, those rocket, equipment, and engine scenes. The background score is so good there that you literally feel like the earth is quaking right there under your seat. The music is situational and that was a really good move by Madhavan. He knew that there was already a lot of stuff to show in Nambi's life, so why waste time on songs? The VFX team has also done a nice job considering the limited budget and scope for it.R. Madhavan makes his debut with this film, and he certainly has a long way to go and a lot to learn. He was handling multiple responsibilities here. Direction, production, writing and acting. It's like rocketry is all about him. So if there's something good, then he is the only person who deserves appreciation, and if there's something wrong, then he is also the only person to be blamed. Nevertheless, it is a very nice attempt. Maybe too much responsibility has put too much pressure on him and that's why I misplaced a few things, but that's still okay. He hasn't dropped the cup down. It's just a little quivering, and then he grabs it. Rocketry could have been an even better product with the kind of sensational story it has, but somewhere something is less. But isn't that too much to ask for? Nobody else dared to pick this story, Madhavan at least tried and gave his honest efforts in making it. So, let's appreciate him for that and overlook small glitches. As a whole, Rockery makes for a worthwhile one-time watch with one of the most important stories coming out of the scientific department of our country. You have to watch to know the greatness of Nambi Narayanan and the superiority of R. Madhavan.RATING - 6/10*

I am reviewing it from a non-Indian (aka non-emotional) perspective:
No doubt the movie plot was interesting but I didn't find Mr. NAMBI a hero that the movie potrayed. Of course he was unfairly treated by the system and he deserves a good compensation from the Indian govt and people. Thus, his acclaims are well deserved. Yet, the way the movie claimed that India is the first nation to go to Mars in the first attempt and Mr. NAMBI made it happen were blatant exaggeration. It seems Mr. Nambi is a brilliant scientist who kept looking for stealing ideas, data, and resources. He got everything from other countries and the movie made a big fuss about it by claiming he did it from scratch. The way the movie presented ISRO was saddening. There were other good scientists, including APJ Kamal, there as well but the movie kind of showed everyone incompetent. The movie showed big contracts with foreign countries were already negotiated by Mr. NAMBI while in reality these high level contracts could not be signed or negotiated without high level govt involvement. I think the movie overestimated Mr. Nambi and thus fictionalized many part of it.

Madhavan makes his directorial debut in Rocketry, a biopic based on the life of Nambi Narayanan. I don't need to write anything about the plot as it's already been covered by most of the reviewers.We need to understand that most if not all biopics have to take creative liberty with their subjects so that it engages us as a movie goer. Otherwise, we would be better off watching a documentary. In recent times, we have seen Indian movie biopics take major creative liberties to make their subject larger than life. Sometimes the makers have to change the characterization of their subject; for example, instead of portraying GR Gopinath as his original Brahmin identity in Sudha Kongara's Soorarai Pottru, it became a story about a downtrodden Non-Brahmin named Maara who rose up and became one of the most powerful Indian airline leaders because it needed to fit Tamil sensibilities and appease Suriya fans. On the other hand, you have hagiographies like NTR Kathanayakudu/Mahanayakudu where the protagonist is basically God and that can never go well.Here Madhavan veers between biopic and hagiography. We see Nambi Narayanan from his early days in ISRO to his elder days. His dedication towards science, space and to his country is commendable. He is so totally dedicated to his job that he will not stop until he's fully satisfied. But he is made to become as this all-knowing superhero genius who can solve everything. Nobody else has anything to contribute around him; they just surround him and applaud his ideas as brilliant. Despite a couple of scenes where his dedication and determination does cost him a slight bit of his human soul, he barely has any flaws. Maybe the real-life Nambi was like this, but the over glorification of the character is hammered hard in our skulls without any nuance.And that's the main reason why Rocketry fails to explore the human side of Nambi. We don't get to know more about him as a person, what made him tick, why he was like this, etc. We get some interesting James Bond espionage type scenes, but because the screenplay glorifies him so much, we don't feel the struggle and humiliation he went through; it just feels hollow. Nor do we get to know his family, his mentors or his friends. They are just satellites surrounding him.A lot of technical jargon is thrown at us and while I'll say that while it is indeed educative and important, you can't bore the audience with it. The pacing makes the movie feel longer than it is and there are a lot of emotional manipulation where the BGM just tries to overpower you with these loud moments that just don't stick, plus the editing is not slick enough to make you care.Having said the above, it is still a story that needed to be told and Madhavan is the sole reason you should watch it. Though he does not fit the role of a 27-year-old student in the beginning portions due to his age (despite still maintaining his good looks), he embodies Nambi Narayanan very well from his 30s all the way until his elderly days. He has put in a lot of hard work and love into this portrayal and despite the hagiographic nature as I earlier mentioned, he does make the character watchable. The real Nambi Narayanan makes an appearance towards the end, and it was good to see him speak in his own voice.On the other hand, the rest of the cast don't have any role to play and it's sad to see Simran, Misha Ghoshal (a talented actress), Karthik Kumar (who reminded me of Atul Kulkarni), Rajiv Kapur/Ravi Raghavendra and Sriram Parthasarathy wasted in underdeveloped roles. While there is some dignity given to the non-Indian actors where they speak their own languages instead of being dubbed in Tamil or Hindi, the less said about them the better. Neither Suriya (Tamil) or Shah Rukh Khan (Hindi) impress in their cameo.Sirsha Ray also deserves credit for the cinematography which helps engage the viewer somewhat and the CGI isn't so bad.Overall, while the majority of people may be inspired and wholly satisfied by this labor of love by Madhavan to Nambi Narayanan, others will feel disappointed that the making did not do justice to the human element of the man. Despite my problems with the movie, I'm glad it was told and it's strictly a one-time watch movie thanks to Madhavan. He is one of the rare actors who cares about his audience and wants to give them good concept and content-based movies. He doesn't fully succeed here, but he did at least engage me somewhat. Hope he improves in his next directorial feature and continues to give appealing content with better form throughout his career.6/10.

reviews.review_title: A film, every citizen of this country should watch!
reviews.content: A competent amalgamation of Drama, Science & Debate, "Rocketry" exhibits an inspirational yet tragedy-filled journey of one genius mind, S. Nambi Narayanan, and his vital contributions in the field of Space engineering that are truly meritorious. Whatever the sacrifices he made, whatever the accomplishments he attained for this country, should have granted him a nicer fate!It pains me to hear that such a true patriot was deprived of the due recognition, due respect that he unquestionably deserved, for so many decades! All thanks to a falsified case, and a premeditated conspiracy against him to derail not just his progression as a pioneer in his field, but also to halt all the advancements in his research and the miraculous discoveries he might have made in the process.The damages that are done are irreversible, and the horrible things he and his family had to go through are disheartening to say the very least. No matter how many apologies he's got, the agonizing pain he endured won't ever get entirely eradicated. He would have to carry this burden until his last breath! The only thing we could do now is to watch this film, spread the word, and make people aware of all the things that transpired.Albeit the technical jargon and a flamboyant exhibition of scientific terminologies might get a bit overwhelming for some but I feel, this film should act as a lesson for every resident, every individual in our country who in comparable instances tend to victimize a person over the slightest skepticism, that too without concrete rationale, and without validating any of the allegations! These media trials, these kinds of malpractices of should come to an end.

reviews.review_title: based on Nambi Narayanan, an Indian scientist
reviews.content: Kudos to producer-director R Madhavan for conceiving #RocketryTheNambiEffect, based on Nambi Narayanan, an Indian scientist who worked at the Indian Space Research Organisation. Extremely intelligent, dedicated, patriotic and badass, he always focused on his goals. He spurned a very lucrative offer from NASA and preferred to work in his own country. It makes your blood boil to see him and his family suffer for no reason. The common man may not appreciate the first half. However, the post-interval sections are intriguing. Performances are excellent. Running time needs to be reduced by 20 minutes. Rating 3/5.

R Madhavan's ambitious project works better in the second half. The biography on Nambi Narayanan is told via flashbacks where Suriya's tv interview anchors the screenplay. The first half is dedicated to show the growth of Nambi as well as establishing what kind of person he is. A patriotic brilliant scientist on a mission, taking forward the legacy of Vikram A Sarabhai. With a lot of scientific and technical jargons, the first half went with expected pace with not too many highs.It is the second half with Nambi Narayanan getting falsely accused as a traitor, the screenplay gets the emotional aspect right. Where the director R Madhavan stumbles, it is the actor R Madhavan who scores big time. Good thing is there is not much insertion of sermons here. Yet, the man and his family's struggle through this phase is effectively captured. The appearance by the real Nambi Narayanan was a fine touch.

reviews.review_title: One of the Best Movie Ever Made of History of Indian Space Research
reviews.content:
Must Watch
Recommended
Uncovers the Hidden Truth of System which spoiled Future of India in Space Research
Best Acting, Superb Execution... casting is great...
Everything is Great about this film.

The long awaited biopic of Nambi Narayanan, former scientist of ISRO has R Madhavan wearing multiple caps: screenwriter, dialogues, director, producer and actor. I can't say that he excels in all departments but he is stellar as Nambi Narayanan.Rocketry is narrated by Nambi Narayanan (Madhavan) to Shah Rukh Khan over a TV interview wherein he covers his early days at Princeton to the time when he was wrongfully accussed of selling secrets to our neighbours.Rocketry rests on the very capable hands of Madhavan. He is perfect as the man who led India's foray into space exploration. Many of the significant events of his life are covered in this 2.5 hour long film. His short tenure at Princeton & NASA, at the France Space Agency and for the most part under the suspicious eyes of his fellow countrymen. Simran (his onscreen wife), Rajit Kapur, Dinesh Prabhakar co-star.Madhavan is a great actor but his filmmaking skills are still in the nascent stages. But given this is his directorial debut and the effort gone into making it, one must give the actor due credit. They could have done away with the TV interview with SRK/Suriya bit. A straight-forward storyline would have been absolutely fine.Madhavan's Rocketry, which he calls his biggest film till date lives upto to the expectations (for most part). A no-nonsense story of a man the country wronged should be on your must watch list for this week.

Madhavan as a director is like a free-flowing river. There is no set blueprint or map to his direction. But that also works in his favour. The actor simultaneously shoots two versions of the movie and it must be a task that only some can pull off. As a director he decides to invest less time in things that the audience already know.R. Madhavan has gone beyond his limit to shape Rocketry and there is no way he could have let anything go wrong from at least his end. The actor has to age back and forth and he manages to make us believe and invest through all of it. Rest everyone does their jobs earnestly and creates a world that is lived in and authentic. There are a lot of good actors involved for parts that are almost special appearances but crucial.Rocketry-The Nambi Effect is an emotional drama about how one of India's famous scientists went through turmoil after being called a traitor.It is about a man who gave this country big achievements but was compensated with brutality. It took almost two decades for the government to give a veteran scientist a clean chit in a case he was never guilty of. It is a story that must be told and heard.

reviews.review_title: A story that has to be heard
reviews.content: Rocketry is the tale of Nambi Narayanan's splendid career as a scientist in the ISRO and how he was subsequently treated when a false case of epsionage was foisted on him. Madhavan deserves praise for picking a subject that not many people might be aware of, and more importantly, not diluting it by adding 'filmi' elements.The first half was all about the achievements of the said scientist depicted in a fashionable way and there were few hiccups with regards to direction and dialogue deliveries, overall being decent.It is in the second half that Rocketry feels more like a film, like a missile suddenly galvanised into action. The dialogues get sharper. Making up for the average directorial skills of Madhavan is actor Madhavan, who springs to life in the portions capturing Nambi's older days. The actor aces some of these sequences, especially the ones that follow his custodial torture. The film is also about choices, and one really wishes that it explored that in more detail.The story of Rocketry is, without doubt, something that audiences have to be told. But, behind that thought is a film that connects only in parts. The actor Madhavan was great, but the director Madhavan could have been better in his assignment.My Rating : 3.5/5.

reviews.review_title: Superbly made, but not for the masses
reviews.content: This is one of those rare films that would entertain, inform and infuriate the viewers.The first hour has too many technical details. For a lousy engineer, such as me, it was difficult to comprehend at many junctures.It is when the action moves to the disintegration of USSR that this moves on to a different, much higher plane.The next 1.30 hours is pure genius.R Madhavan, who is the director and writer, is superb as the titular Nambi. He is effortless in the younger version and empassioned in the older avatar.The story is stirring and made me feel ashamed, by my ignorence of it and angry, because of the impact it had on the scientist's lifeIt is very well made, though certainly not for the masses.

reviews.review_title: Poignant saga of an innocent scientist thrown in jail
reviews.content: This movie is a twin achievement for R Madhavan. One, as actor he has done an excellent job in bringing to life the trials and tribulations of an Indian aerospace scientist falsely accused of selling secret information to a foreign country. He is branded traitor, arrested and jailed for bringing shame and disgrace to the country. The movie is a one man show and his is an award winning performance. Two, as director he has made a gripping film which keeps you hooked till the end. After Nambi is thrown in jail, his family is ostracized , they are socially isolated, and considered outcasts. The movie is also a clear illustration to show that for anti nationals it is easy to bring down a patriotic and successful person using false charges. Arrest and torture will invariably follow and the court proceedings will continue at a snail's pace. The protagonist here is space scientist Nambi Narayan who is determined to bring India to the forefront in space exploration for which he goes to and seeks assistance from foreign nations like France, Scotland and Russia. He rises professionally due to sheer tenacity, grit and audacity coupled with a burning desire. There are some nicely filmed scenes of laboratory experiments on engines, the setbacks, the successes and the complications technical and otherwise. The airlift of engine components from Russia make for exciting viewing. Few scenes worth mentioning. When asked why no one from ISRO came to visit him in jail, Nambi says that "scientists are strange people because when a rocket falls they react but when a person falls they don't know how to react". Nambi's colleagues describe his eccentricity and audacity in asking for and planning the hardware for research work. Out on bail he continues doggedly on the Mars mission. The scenes where Nambi is boycotted by all and he gets thrown out of the autorickshaw in heavy rain is very touching. The movie unfolds on a flashback mode as Nambi is being interviewed on TV by Shahrukh Khan. Some poignant scenes there. A truly emotional moment at the end when the real Nambi sums up his aim in life and is shown receiving Padma award. One wishes however that the technical jargon could have been kept to the bare minimum, and the running time cropped by around 20 minutes.

reviews.review_title: Well Made And Watchable But Apparently Not The Entire Story
reviews.content: Rocketry: The Nambi Effect (Primevideo orig. Tamil w/Eng. Subs. Also available in several other languages ) is a narration about reknowned scientist Dr Nambi Narayanan's eventful career, his implication in a spying case, his eventual redemption and Padma Shree award. The narrative unfolds through flashback while a star anchor (Surya) interviews Dr Nambi (Madhavan and Dr Nambi himself).This is a real life story that undoubtedly deserves to be told. The film though very watchable ... has some stilted dialogues stuck in here and there.The first part of the film, somewhat slow, is about Nambi's enthusiasm, his stints abroad and his rise in the organisation. Most of the characters are taken from real life though Im not sure about all the events. For instance, did Nambi really unforgivably withhold from Unni (Sam Mohan) the news of his child's sudden death which would be the most tragic, the most unbearable grief for any parent to endure? Was the film maker trying to imply that Unni's curses when he eventually came to know many days later, somehow lead to Nambi's subsequent ordeal? Did Unni really take the lead in trying to clear Nambi's name?Another question on how authentic the films depiction is comes from interesting news reports post film release including an item in The Hindu today 25/8/2022 reporting the statement released by several ISRO veterans challenging Dr Nambi Narayan's scientific achievement claims . I quote a brief extract from the news item: "Many of the claims in the Madhavan starrer ... Rocketry ... and those made by Mr Narayanan in various forums are baseless and tend to mislead the public, the former scientists which included D. Sasikumar who (had) .. also been implicated in the spy case, .... told a meet-the-press programme ... Thiruvananthapuram Press Club..."Nevertheless, the characters are effectively portrayed by the respective actors and the overall narration holds the viewers interest .. though something is missing that could have elevated this film a few notches.A last "politically correct scene" focussed on ..... seems to be a probable path to Best Film, Best Actor etc at the next National Awards ...... Good Luck !!!

reviews.review_title: An ordinary film about an extraordinary man
reviews.content: Rocketry: The Nambi Effect is a biopic about famed rocket scientist Nambi Narayanan, chronicling his life from youth to present. Not knowing much about the man himself going into this movie, it most certainly proved to be an informative experience that presents all his hardships and establishes his undeniable contribution to space travel and rocket science.And while the movie succeeds at introducing Nambi to the audience for the truly remarkable man he is, it somewhat fails as a work of storytelling. Rocketry suffers a lot from not having an experienced writer handling the screenplay and that painfully shows throughout. The movie feels like you're reading a 157-minute long Wikipedia article and not a well crafted work of storytelling to truly bring out the emotions within. There just seems to be so much potential lost in its very lukewarm and bland writing approach. This extends also into its dialogues... which while ends up being more technical than it should, also ends up being overly expositional, emotionless and stale. Almost all of the English parts in the movie are as apparent as being written by a non-English speaker, as the choice of words, the string of sentences and the tone of communication seem too odd and too unnuanced to be realistic. It also needs to be said that there could have been more emphasis on casting as well, as all the foreign actors come across as amateur as could be. Be it their dialogue delivery, facial expressions, body language and overall performances... it just seems too artificial.That said, it's still a good movie for one to watch, as the pros outweigh the cons. It certainly took the right approach in trying to not succumb to usual Tamil cinema conventions and that should be commended. Plus, the contributions Nambi Narayanan has made to rocket science is one that most people should be aware of, and to communicate that as effectively as it did is the strongest part about this movie.

In direction part , despite few flaws Maddy done a decent job in it . Major drawback was dialogues and dubbing , both parts were underwhelming . Technically , VFX and production design were good . Anwar Says: Kudos to R. Madhvan , who thought of creating biopic of Nambi Narayanan . It has been a trend to present biopic of rags to riches, but this one has been so masterly written and narrated by Madhvan that you would start loving this comparatively less known scientist.The first half of the movie would take you to the brilliance of mind of Nambi, solid and liquid fuels , leaving his lucrative appointment at NASA for the sake of country and the second half encapsulates his struggles, due to petty politics, which ultimately delayed the Mangal Mission. The best idea was to bring the real Hero Nambi himself at the end.A must see , whether you are a science student or not.#VootSelect #anwarsays #NambiNarayanan #RMadhvan #NASA #isroindia #movie2022 #MarsMission #ShahRukhKhan #pettypolitics #rocketfuel.

reviews.review_title: Its not a true biopic , please search for the validation of facts
reviews.content: I am a big fan of biopic movies, as its true story . Having said that , since its a movie there will be always commercial aspect which drives it . The movie maker always try to sensationalize the subject by adding spice and some incorrect details, which is ok for a movie, but not to be misunderstood as facts. So I always take time to validate the claims in the movie, so that I do not perpetuate incorrect facts. So for my disappointment I could not validate major events depicted in the movie in any other external sources other than movie promotion websites. Especially the 400 million deal from Colonel Cleaver the CEO of Rolls Royce, I would say watch it as a movie and not true facts. On top of that the movie making style resembles typical Vijay , or James bond masala movies ! It entertains larger than life hero worshipers for sure !

reviews.review_title: One of the best auto biographies seen
reviews.content: Heard rave reviews about this movie, but was little apprehensive and thought it would be like a documentary, but it was mind blowing screenplay and direction and storytelling at its best!Watched it on Amazon Prime and had to turn the subtitles on, as many of the dialogues were in English and was not able to catch them, so sound engineering and mixing could have been better.Some of the visuals and aerial shots were breath taking, especially the ones taken in Russia and Princeton University.Cried in the last few scenes seeing the hardships faced by Mr Nambi Narayanan even through common citizens, although he worked hard for the nation's development and a very loyal citizen! Film also brings into light the politics involved in our elite Space programmes.Inspite of all the positives mentioned above, last 30 minutes could have been curtailed by 15 mins to make the film not dragging!Would like to watch this film one more time to understand the science behind Rockets a little more and catch the dialogues even better.

reviews.review_title: Never do this to another genius in India....

reviews.review_title: R.Mahdawan one of the great actors of Indian cinema hands down.
reviews.content: *) K Reviews *) ( ( The story is as real as it can be. This Was top class, outstanding and brilliant film.... What a man..... Proud of you sirMadhavan didn't acted in this film he just lived it... What a writing man spell bounded with your writing.What an editing... Wow
What a bgm... Heart touching
What a capturing the scene... Excellent.This film will be in my library for ever, the film that will close to your heart...loved it.

I'm so glad they show how beautiful other countries are and how well developed and supporting other countries are towards their scientist,They actually know what being a scientist means ,unlike in india they just treat them as school teachers who know some chemicals and chemistry subject,this movie shows true colours of India as a nation and why it will never be developed as the breed of humans in this part of the world are personification of corruption and evil,This movie shows how indians treat their heros and how they still now down to the west . reviews.review_title: A moral indictment of India itself!
reviews.content: Rocketry: The Nambi Effect is a story of one of India's most famous rocket scientists, Nambi Narayanan. Nambi goes to America to study at Princeton, then organizes a program where India helps France to develop the Arianne rocket engines, then oversees the development of the Vikas engine, India's crowning achievement in liquid-fuel propulsion. But when he reaches for a cryogenic technology, in an attempt to buy the technology from Russia, he is attacked by local police and his career is ruined for almost a decade by Foreign interference.What many people might not understand is that this is a movie about corruption in India. India does not have a strong legal system. India's legal system cannot protect its best and brightest and most patriotic scientists. With a small bribe, India's greatest rocket scientist has his life ruined, and an entire industry of commercial satellite launches was so easily destroyed. I have many Indian friends who have "escaped" to North America. Let this movie be a lesson to everyone. Until you reform your legal system and clean up the corruption, you will be a puppet to foreign powers. If you don't produce these reforms, India will trail the rest of the world in technology, forever. Your best and brightest will leave India to gain the security that they deserve! The choice is up to you, India!

For a movie claiming to be a biopic of a ISRO scientist, they could have done the basic research right and could have put the facts in place. For a scientist who was already traumatized by the vagaries of the system, this was an opportunity for the production team to put things from his perspective. Instead they chose to take a path that would appeal to certain sections of the society instead of telling the whole truth.Apart from the fallacies in the story line, Madhavan's acting at best can be described as ordinary if not bad. For a star who was adored by our entire generation, this is pretty below his standards. What Madhavan is capable of as an actor can be seen in films like Yuva. This is a fall for the erstwhile star.
What an awesome movie it is! The film shows the reality of an Indian scientist. R Madhavan did fantastic work. Every Indian should watch the movie once at least.

A lot of movies are entertaining, some are excellent but only few of them are important. Rocketry is one such movie, this biographical adaptation of Nambi sir's turbulent life and his perseverance deserves your time and undivided attention kudos to madhavan for bringing this epic tale to cinemas, Indian audience is thankful to him.

reviews.review_title: Thanks R. Madhavan for all the efforts to make this movie!
reviews.content: It is so heartening to see Rocketry - The Nambi effect after watching a TV series 'Rocket boys' earlier this year, which brought to the notice of Indian citizens, unheard contributions of people like Vikram Sarabhai / Homi Bhabha / Abdul Kalam and now Nambi Narayan, the ISRO scientist. Being R. Madhavan's directorial debut, it lacks some finesse, however the story is so inspiring, that one can't with hold oneself from thanking Madhavan on making such a movie, where covering all the costs on release is always suspect, unless it is tax exempted. It is a must watch for all Indians.

Rarely ever we come across a brilliant movie from india and this movie happens to be one which will not only prove how we backstabbed one of our brilliant scientists and went so behind in the satellite launching.A brilliant portrayal of Padma Bhushan Nambi Narayanan by Madhavan and very well supported by Sharukh Khan.Advice: Must Watch.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely brilliant acting by Mahdhvan ! Must watch
reviews.content: Absolutely brilliant acting by Mahdhvan as Nambi Narayan ! Must watch. The story and narrative keeps you engrossed throughout the movie . It's a must watch for every Indian atleast once . Deserves a lot of appreciation for all the hard work out into the movie by the entire team of Rocketry.

Rocketry is highly patriotic with lots of goosebumps moments.Padma Bhushan awardee Nambi Narayanan is the hidden aerospace gem of ISRO.Madhavan as a producer, director and actor has embodied Nambi with full effect. Oscar worthy performances by him and Simran.Screenplay is highly commendable. Nambi's genius ideas, struggles and raising against all odds is inspiring for generations.Don't miss this gem.

This movie is full of class but it has no mass. That movie is a true biopic for Nambi sir and it explains every part of his life very deeply without any masala. Usually in biopics directors add some fiction to make the biopic interesting but it is just very real. It is not for every type of audience because some will like it and some will not , The people who like genre like comedy and action could be bored while watching the film but overall the film is worth watching and damn Madhavan Sir, He has done a great job what a perfection at acting as well as direction too and the other actors also gave their best and the cameo of Shah Rukh Khan is also very interesting. It has some English dialouges so some people could suffer issues while watching this film and it is purely a family friendly film.

India has truly never treated her scientists right. This is the story of one such scientist who was wronged on a supreme level. The story is in public domain but the justice to him was so delayed that, like the idiom goes, it was as good as denied. Kudos to R Madhavan for taking up his story and telling it to the world. However, while doing so, he has been remiss in many aspects.The movie is frequently extremely on-the-nose and, overall, crudely done. A woman who hasn't smiled in years smiled because of our leading man and we see a nagging mention of it even though we never saw how that equation developed. People around our leading man keep telling us how exceptional he is but we don't really get to witness his smartness until much later. Little factoids keep getting thrown around and the characters append "most people in India don't know this" after saying them in an obvious attempt to be didactic towards the audience.The film also frequently takes itself too seriously and whenever it does so it, to much disappointment, pulls focus away from its genuine attempts at storytelling. One subjective issue I take with the film is its act of glorifying the one thing that the lead character was indefensibly wrong about. It doesn't even try to put a spin on it to talk about the flip-side of it. And sadly it delivers this sore justification through Shah Rukh Khan.Shah Rukh Khan is fantastic in his cameo/supporting act. He has been given terrible dialogs and screenplay and yet he does his best to deliver it on his charm and screen presence. R Madhavan is as fantastic as ever. He carries the film on his shoulders with great expertise. Sadly, the same cannot be said about his direction and screenplay-writing, which leave much to be desired.I am going with a 6/10 with an extra star solely because this is a story that needs to be heard by all. We can't undo the wrong done to Nambi Narayanan but hopefully we don't commit this mistake against our future scientists.

Hard hitting film that shows reality. Well-made film and well-acted film by R Madhavan. I can say R Madhavan is India's one of the best actors. Also he is a true filmmaker who took such a bold subject to make a move and shows to the world how Congress party destroyed a true scientist and judiciary is useless and failed to protect a scientist.

The movie keeps you hooked with it the entire time
Screenplay is tight and swift.All the cast has played their roles very well.The ending was damn emotional.Hats off to the makers.

reviews.review_title: Isnt it just like any other biopic?
reviews.content: This movie ha sit all what a biopic should be having the struggles , a love story , and the happy ending. For some reason it isnt really boring. There isn't necessarily a plot twist but the movie had my focus cause most of the biopics reach a point where i really can't watch it anymore but this is brilliant its emotional and all bu its great.

This film will have you swelling with pride, because it is one of the rare films which underlines Indian brilliance, chutzpah and daring;to aim and achieve the impossible, on ridiculously inadequate budgets, including our extraordinary Mars mission.

The movie tells the story of Nambi Narayanan, one of the pioneer scientist who played a big part in where India stands today in Space Programme. The movie talks about his role in building up India's space programme and how he was falsely implicated in an epsionage charge and tortured in custody. The Supreme Court finally clears him of all the charge but it can never give back what he had to undergo nor are any action taken against the people who framed him.It talks about the continous effort of our scientist, the challenges, the politics, the meagre resources in hand and how inspite all that how we have become self sufficient and independent in our space programme.Kudos to Madhavan for making this movie, else many like me would never have known.Madhavan has done a good job with good support from the supporting cast.From a direction and editing point of view, i felt it could have been better.

Can't able to live through the moments that Mr Nambi has gone through. On one side the detailing is great on the rocket science and on the other side the tragedy is haunting us. But the politics or agenda behind this wasn't explained more detail. Beautiful cast and making that makes you connect through out the movie.

reviews.review_title: More than a Movie, it's a historical Event
reviews.content: There are so many real events that we don't know and not they are thrilling but need to be in front of Indian audience so they get to know who are the people responsible for the country's growth in a particular field.Nambi is one such person and his story is not just inspirational but full of unexpected events including achievements and perils.Why people want to bring him done is beyond me. It's a shame for us that these people got such treatment after they did so much for the country.R Madavan Rocketery tells this story in the best way possible and the cameo of Shah Rukh Khan was brilliantly done.I am fascinated and surprised why does Bollywood not able to make such movies. It does not have a 100 cr budget. Don't need VFX flicks but pure gems like this one.

"ROCKETRY THE NAMBI EFFECT" in my opinion is easily the best movie(that's been dubbed in Hindi)of 2022. Madhavan must be complimented in the manner how he simplified an extremely complicated subject as rocket science and merged it with his personal achievements and tragedy to come up with a masterpiece! Everything and everyone was brilliant including Shah Rukh who although,he had a very short and unchallenging role was superb! Madhavan was absolutely amazing in his acting and his direction of this very well edited film was top notch!9/10.

One of the gem of the movies seen in the recent past. Mind blowing movie made by Madhavan and cast . Shah Rukh Khan was outstanding as an anchor to a show in his brief role. Madhavan was really great in portraying the character of the great scientist Nambi Narayanan. One scene i will never forget in my life , Simran , the veteran actor , going into depression and shouting on seeing her husband being released from 50 days of jail. That particular scene I felt goosebumps after a long long long time. What an effort made by the entire cast and crew of the movie. Kudos to the entire team which was involved in making this movie. The audience was left speechless and spell bounded after watching the movie . Very rarely do we get to see such an outstanding movie in the world of Hindi cinema.

Have to admit that got to know about Sir Nambi only after this movie came out in public. Such an inspirational, adventurous and heart-breaking journey. Madhavan has done justice to the role and the movie had been sincerely. Felt glued to each and every scene. Scientists do so much for our country and the ones who dedicate their whole life for their country only while keeping their friend families emotions aside is such a sacrifice. And then there are people who try to bring them down. Some insiders, some outsiders. And that not just affects the scientist, his family but also brings the nation down or takes it backwards.
Madhvan's sir acting, direction awesome. An amazing story that every Indian must know. Awesome I loved this rocket science flick and the politics behind it and hella proud of ISRO.

This movie was one of the best Indian space movies I've seen. Loved this more than Mission Mangal. More than just space research, it showed the brilliant life of Nambi sir. It does speak of rocket science every now and then. That espionage case part wasn't dragged or exaggerated, which was good move from filmmaking point of view. There were a few scenes that were slow but overall the movie was fabulous! There's no exaggeration, no politicizing matters, etc. I can understand the seriousness with which this film has been made. Hats off to the director, and each part of film crew, and of course, to our legend Nambi sir!Production Values seemed good on OTT. One issue is that some flashback scenes are shown very quickly and it takes time to understand what just happened. Apart from that the film was very good. One of those rare films (like TKF, 777 Charlie, Interstellar etc.) That I can give 9+/10. Loved the last message, Nambi sir is innocent but who was actually guilty?

reviews.review_title: When your own country betrays you.

I am speechless ! This movie is just best at its place and shows the struggle,fight and eventual victory of Indian scientist Nambi Narayanan Sir. I bow before these great Indian's glorious story who dedicated his whole life for this country. Jai Hind !

reviews.review_title: R Madhavan delivers his career best act
reviews.content: Rocketry: The Nambi Effect is a well made biopic that documents the life of Nambi Narayanan in the best possible manner. Of course, the screenplay has its share of flaws as mentioned above, but you leave the hall feeling for all that the ace scientist had to face in his life. Madhavan get's the grammer (structure) of filmmaking right, though the sentence formation (read screenplay) has some errors.

I am speechless ! The film depicts the struggle, battle and eventual victory of the Indian scientist Nambi Narayanan Sir. I bow before these great Indian's glorious story who dedicated his whole life for this country. You must watch this movie scientist are hero as army man. Jai hind 🇮🇳

I'm sure for India the real history is precious, but the movie is a shame, hard to watch, screenplay is just a joke, the the story is made by a 4-year old, the acting is nauseous, the dialogue resembles a junkie putting up lines on the 4-year old's story, the reality is wronged numerous times, the budget is lacking and seen in the decor, the costumes, the employed actors...
I though that being so highly rated in the Indian top 250, it would at least be something worth checking.I was wrong.PS. I was asked it the review contains spoilers, what kind of spoiler one needs when there is some action every few scenes, with a turning points all over the place, but none of meaningful sway. A real disappointment.

No words. Only one feeling.. why I didn't know you before. Why was I watching Kuch Kuch Hota Hai, when you were facing such brutality. Why was I waiting in line to book First Day First Show of Baadshah, when you were fighting for your dignity. I am ashamed of me. I am ashamed of my society where we celebrated and hailed impotent screen heroes, while our real heroes like you were battling to prove their innocence. Hum sharminda hai, that we were not there to support you. Hum sharminda hai, that we didn't even knew about you. I am sorry for your difficulties, I am sorry for the ordeal you had to face. I am sorry!

One of the very few movies that leaves the audience breathless & choked. The ultimate story that jolts everyone with a million questions and a vision of "what-if". This is not just the story of Sir Nambi Narayan, but about all those great people who peacefully strived to the best in their field and yet undervalued & undermined.

reviews.review_title: Another level of quality with an engaging storytelling
reviews.content: Hats off to Mr. Madhvan. This movie keeps moving just moving, I would say not a scene is longer than 30 seconds. One after one, scene sequence just keeps you take the most of the story. How incredible Mr. Nambi is!Fixing things, setting things in foreign, making network and without a help of the government! This really is our unsung hero. Never knew his name before. Tha last scene when he leaves on his old Activa breaks my heart. A true genius rising an Activa, goes by himself! How senseless government and people treated him. A true gem was finally identified by government in 2019 and he was honoured.Actually without his support we couldn't have been this far in the rocket space as we are now.And... absolutely you can disagree ut, SRK was the WORST FIT. Just worst. I don't have words.Loved your quality in storytelling Mr. Madhvan, just loves it. Thank you Mr. Numbu Narayan for your unmatchable efforts to make India shine.
Best Movie ever. My most favourite movie by my most favourite actor. Maddy is Love. Bharat is what it is because of sacrifices made by Great men like Nambi Narayanan.
Madhavan as an ISRO scientist Nambi did an excellent Job. It is a watchable movie. And for madhavan fans it's a Treat on Big screen. The movie showcase the ISRO.

reviews.review_title: A great and new type of movie by r madhavan
reviews.content: Movie is so good . The story of people like nambi narayan should come between us . I personally didn't even heard his name before this movie so I thanks Maddy to bring this awesome scientist story in front of us from which personally I was unaware . Movie is crisp and to the point . The research Maddy and crew has done is marvelous . The way story runs is also decent . Personally I would love to see madhvan in more these type of roles . He is one man army in this movie . The foreign Actors are also well picked otherwise in indian movies white Actors acting is horrible but not in this case . The things I didn't like that some Dialogues in which he says "we indians" good at omelette , "we indians" known household works very well and etc. These"we indians" sounds good in 1-2 initial dialogues but after that again and again repetition of same "we indians" dialogues looks pseudo and not good . Glad they stopped those dialogues after 45 minutes of movie . Supporting indian cast could have been better but in this budget I think the visuals and cast he has chose his decent . Hoping for more these Type of movies in future which motivates us to study hard and inspire us in every sector .

Fill proud when watch this type of movies....Proud to our scientist..........but we are say with sad we are
not appreciate to our scientist.........
Liked it,loved it, madhvan is my fav.i love his work. Must watch movie for everyone. Fabulous outstanding awesome. Book a ticket ....just go n watch it.

reviews.review_title: A must-watch - an ode to unsung heroes
reviews.content: Thank you Team Rocketry for tell this story- it had to be told - and how beautifully and compassionately it was told. Immense respect and love to Shri Nambi Narayanan and family- as a family they have contributed so much to Indian Space Research and accomplishments. This movie showcased the adventures, challenges and accomplishments of our resilient and brilliant scientists- they are a pride of our nation - it is important that we acknowledge them and their work. Thank you for this brilliant story 🙏

The slow unfolding story, quality acting and dialogues. It is a nice entertainer. The pain of the scientist is communicated through the brilliant acting. The cast also justifies the characters. Overall a film worth of your time.!

reviews.review_title: Patriotic. Excellent movie. Madhavan in a different Avatar
reviews.content: A must watch movie. We should support such movies and make the film industry become healthy.Very healthy movie. Amazing.CANT EXPRESS IN WORDS. NEED TO FEEL IT. 10 stars is worth it.Madhaavan in a different Avatar. Just brilliant.

If you are pulling to watch a movie that can capture your brain and heart at the same time, it is this movie. As a movie, it was fantastic. Couldn't have been better. Storyline- what could be more perfect than real life. Character building and retention of the characteristics- mind blowing.Nothing about this movie is unbelievable.A masterpiece everyone should watch. Teary eyed for a large part. Very real characters. Amazing acting by each performer.Direction, screenplay, dialogues- all of it is fantastic. What can a family go through? What can an individual go through?Loved it is not enough to say. Movies of this linger in minds of viewers for a very long time. Because it inspires them.A must watch!

reviews.review_title: Speechless- Must watch for every Indian
reviews.content: Well after a log time I have watched such a movie.... I watched it with eng subs on prime..ufff Everyone must watch it..i was in tears at the end. Maddy is just incredible..I started watching it as a ordinary patriotic movie but when it became extraordinary I don,t know.This movie will definitely get a national/Oscar award.Just one thing I would say at the end...Dunt miss this one such movies r made rarely and we should be thankful for south indian cinema for giving such masterpiece.

To all india...we must watch this movie...kya bawal banaya hai mahdvan ne....super act and looks so real...I was not aware about shri nambi ji... what he suffered for us....mostly last 10 minutes...best wishes to all team..who show us the real truth....my best wishes..

reviews.review_title: Nambi Sir...We R Sorry and Maddy Sir We are Proud
reviews.content: I was in awe of this movie when I first saw the trailer and wanted to see first day first show. But better late than Never.What a show no over the top drama, crisp story amazing dialogues and brilliant performances. A true biography if so to say.To be honest, I was one of those illiterates who dint knew about Nambi sir and how we as a Nation failed him before the trailer. After trailer, I read about him and wanted to see how Madhavan sir had potrayed it on screen.It wouldn't be wrong to say I was blown over, it dint seem a lengthy film, character's very apt and happy to see a movie with no song breaks, just the story.In movies like these, songs actually break the flow rather than binding the script in commercial masala movies.

reviews.review_title: A film a Biopic and a mirror
reviews.content: After watching this film, I feel that there are Indian film makers who can take risk and pursue their dreams.The hero of the film Nambi Narayan played by Madhavan has been handled amazingly.After seeing the film, I initially thought of it as another film showing the blatant patriotism and show fake scientists like 'Mission Mangal' , but this sets apart a film from being another entertainer or a classRocketry is a class A film, researched film, not afraid to use scientific terms, like mission mangal puri tel logicsProduction design was realistic enough to tell storyI think BG score could have improved.On political front how politics was played is something which as Indians should be shamefulFor Nambi , given Padma Bhushan is one thing that Govt of India tries to remove its guilt of disrespecting an ace scientist .

reviews.review_title: R.Madhavan is a class!! What an impact of the movie!
reviews.content: A must watch movie to get to know more of our scientists who did so much for our country and what they got in return.Each character so delight to watch! Completely enjoyed my time!!

WOW....what a movie. Really made me emotional while watching. Watched it on Netflix and one of the best biopics made. Also it conveys the true story of what happened to a Patriot. Nambi Narayan Sir salute.

reviews.review_title: Determination, Devotion, and Hard Science in this endearing bio-pic
reviews.content: A nice bio-drama for one of India's top rocket scientists. As a Westerner, without pre-existing background knowledge, some parts were a bit hard to follow on the first viewing. I was wondering for half of the film why people were mad at this guy during the intro scenes, and even later on it takes a while to be explained. But there are many nice vignettes of key moments in the career of Mr. Nambi, with tough decisions, backdoor dealings, family drama, real-world science, and some of the most intense rocket test music I've ever heard in a movie! Solid performances from the entire cast.Some of the transitions between time periods were very abrupt and made the film feel less smooth and cohesive than it otherwise could. But for anyone wanting a good bio-pic of a determined individual overcoming adversity, or you are just obsessed with anything space-related like me, Rocketry is a good time at the movies.

reviews.review_title: Rocketry, R Madhavan thanks and Mr. Nambi Narayan Thank you and We are sorry.
reviews.content: How can we be so blind? How can we be so heartless? How can we be so ungrateful to the Man that spent his whole life as a devoted patriot, a true indian of whom we can't even ask for forgiveness for what as humans we have done with him. I apologize for not knowing who he is. Forever grateful to this man for taking ISRO and making indian capable enough to compete with the world in space programs. We are forever in your debt. I just began this movie as I love R. Madhavan's acting buy sir thanks a million for this one, I owe for bringing this movie. I bow down to you for bringing this to people. I lie down in front of MR. Nambi Narayan as a thank you and to apologize for everything sir. Hats off. Thank you so much.

What a movie yar....thank you nambi sir for your patriotism..... really you are a super hero for millions.....love you Maddy for making such beautiful movie and all the very best to make a such types of great story movie in future.
What an acting by Madhavan amazing story and brilliant direction. Its a must Watch Movie and don't miss a chance and everyone should watch. Movies like this will only make bollywood alive.

Hats off to the makers of such a well-enacted film. Madhavan was amazing in carrying the role of Dr. Nambi and in bringing his trials and tribulations to life onscreen. Bowled over by the plot as well as the performances. Immense respect for the makers.

reviews.review_title: A Mist watch for Every Indian
reviews.content: Lets not judge this Movie like a Movie because its more than that. Its a true story which we must know because what happened with Nambi Sor should not happen again in our country.

This movie is a must watch for every Indian or anyone for that matter. This movie based on life of an Indian scientist Nambi Narayanan shows ups and downs of a life and how vested interests meddle with people's life.

What a fantastic film Madhavan has made. There are no words to describe Nambi Narayana sir's patriotism for the nation. ISRO is very fortunate to have such a talented scientist on staff. I'd like to thank Mr. Nambi Narayan sir for his Vikas engine and all of his other wonderful contributions to the nation. Finally, a fantastically directed film, and I congratulate Madhavan on his outstanding work.
Finally after 3 decades someone made an excellent movie to share the truth of a great India scientist and the international conspiracy to keep India down.

reviews.review_title: Great directoron and acting by Madhavan
reviews.content: Great movie for his first directorial debut by Madhavan . He has acted well too so have the actors like Simran . There is lots of drama and the way Surya has been used is fantastic . All in all a must watch .The whole episode of how he was falsely accused is covered well . Every detail cannot be contained within a movie. A book could do justice or maybe a series would do it, but definitely not a movie. The first half of this movie had a crash course on Rocket Science or maybe that was required to set the context, but it could have been said differently. The 2nd half became interesting and one tends to wonder how a patriot rocket scientist could endure all this torture! The people behind this have to pay.. someday! A good movie, but it definitely has some numerous rough edges!

reviews.review_title: Masterful biographical drama that is a must-watch
reviews.content: "Rocketry: The Nambi Effect" is a masterful biographical drama that is a must-watch for anyone interested in space technology, Indian history, or simply a great story told with exceptional filmmaking. This film is the result of the hard work and dedication of actor-director R. Madhavan, who has poured his heart and soul into this project to bring the incredible true story of Nambi Narayanan to life on the big screen.The film offers a powerful and compelling narrative of Nambi Narayanan's life as a scientist and aerospace engineer who was falsely accused of espionage. Madhavan's portrayal of Nambi is nothing short of breathtaking, capturing the complexities of the man and his extraordinary journey with nuance and empathy. The rest of the cast also delivers stellar performances, bringing depth and authenticity to the characters they portray.The film's technical aspects are equally impressive, with stunning cinematography, detailed set designs, and a captivating musical score. The visuals are stunning, immersing the viewer in the world of ISRO and its quest for space exploration.Above all, "Rocketry: The Nambi Effect" is a timely reminder of the value of scientific research and the impact it can have on the world. The film shows the challenges faced by scientists in their pursuit of knowledge and innovation, and how these challenges can sometimes be compounded by political and personal factors.In conclusion, "Rocketry: The Nambi Effect" is an exceptional film that is both entertaining and enlightening. It is a cinematic experience that will leave you feeling inspired, educated, and deeply moved. This movie is a must-watch for anyone who loves great storytelling, and I highly recommend it to everyone.

Absolutely every Indian should see and get inspired. R Madhavan has handled the story so extremely well. No nonsense and focused on advancing the story. The cast is a perfect choice, it doesn't digress for a minute from the story. And there are no other digressions, songs or musical. Job done just right for a story chosen that MUST be heard. Thank you, R Madhavan and Team.

Indian audience not watching Brilliant movie like ROCKETRY and then crying that Industry don't make good movie for them?...like really

Keeping true to the story of Nambi sir, it serves as a wake-up call to Indian society and the people to truly appreciate who are their real patriots and silent sufferers, the criminal injustice of our so called Justice system and the propensity of our own to pull down people of ambition and brilliance.SRK cameo is interspersed and interesting concept. The drama is to the point and does not lingerIt was a gut wrenching story something I was aware of as a teenager in India but the scale and magnitude of its tragedy only became apparent now.Indians should be aware that even so called friendly western countries may not be really friendly as competition heats up in globalisation.

This guy is a genius and helped build India fire its own satellite in space. Amid all the "rocket science", there is an angle where this man is alleged for a treason which damages his entire reputation whereas he is always committed to his country. I think the magic moment was when the acting Mr. Nambi Narayan (Madhavan) is replaced by the real Nambi Narayan towards the end. Story is well crafted and executed, kudos to Madhavan to conceptualize and execute this story beautifully.I don't know why this movie was not so successful in the theaters but I think it's a great movie that every Indian should see.

reviews.review_title: Superb story base and Amazing picturisation.
reviews.content: The biographical drama is about the life of Dr Nambi Narayanan, who was instrumental in developing the Vikas engine and is also a Padma Bhushan awardee.The film gives the audience a glimpse into his rise to the top and how a false allegation impacted him and his family to the extent of great misery. The film sheds light on various periods of his life, right from his days at Princeton University to his eventual arrest and then his hunger and fight for justice. However, what remained constant was the former ISRO scientist's love for the nation, and that's what strongly holds the film together.Overall worth a watch or must say a must watch Movie with whole family.

Biopic of Shri Padma Bushan Nambi Narayan, An ISRO Scientist who has sacrifice his Life for the betterment of our country & what he & his family faced because of his good deeds he did to our country is showcased in this filmTalking about the performance start of this movie was slow but still R. Madhavan's performance was excellent I mean after watching this film i can't imagine who else would have played Nambi Narayan role but him, His wife's character was played by Simran Bagga 2nd half of this film is just about his family where her performance is mind blowing there were some scenes where I got goosebumps, Sam mohan has played Unni's character in this film who too has played his character on point, Shahrukh Khan has done a guest appearance in this film his performance at the climax bought tears in my eyes i was missing this Shahrukh Khan from long time, must talk about the screenplay which i personally think is life of this film, There are many places in this film where you can whistle, Other departments of the film was good but could have been better.All & all Decent film which every citizen of India must watch & appreciate.I strongly recommend this film to watch in theatres.#RocketryTheNambiEffectReview #RocketryTheNambiEffect #RocketryTheFilm #rocketrymoviereview #rocketry #TheNambiEffect #filmreview #whentusharspeaks #innovativeadda #rmadhavan.
